moves.1. d4: This game is a Catalan miniature, which features some nice tactical motifs.  I haven't annotated it too deeply, but everyone should be able to enjoy this game.
moves.8. Nc3: Polugayevsky-Pachenko went 8. Qe2 b5 9. Rd1 Be7; 10. b3 cb; 11. ab 0-0; 12. e4, with positional compensation for the pawn.
moves.9... b5 10. e4: More usual is 10. Rd1 or 10. a4, either securing the d-pawn or creating weaknesses in blacks queenside before opening the center.
moves.10... e5: This is the error that lets White get the initiative.  After 10...Be7; 11. d5 Nb4; 12. Ne5 ed; 13. ed 0-0; 14. a3 Nd3; 15. Nxd3 Bg4, gives Black a reasonable game.
